name: Span of a Set" },
statementHtml: Find the span of the set S = {(1, 2), (3, 4)} in R^2.
hints: Hint: Think about what vectors you can combine to get any vector in R^2.
solutionHtml:
To find the span, we need to determine which linear combinations of the given vectors produce all possible vectors in R^2. We can start by combining the two vectors:

  • \( (1, 2) + (-3, -4) = (-2, -2) \)
  • \( (1, 2) + (0, 2) = (1, 4) \)

This shows that we can combine the vectors to produce any vector in R^2. Therefore, the span of S is all of R^2.
